editionStmt.p: Record edited by Emmanuel FRANCIS CNRS, CEIAS UMR 8564, EHESS/CNRS.

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
This palm-leaf bundle, a composite manuscript contains between the two woodcovers:
Kantarantāti-y-urai (text by Aruṇakirinātar and commentary interspersed).
Tiruppātiriveṇpā-v-urai (text and commentary interspersed).
Tiruvācakam stanzas.

supportDesc.foliation: Inside woodcovers. 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: C/45. This title-page does not correspond to the content of the bundle: the Piḷḷaiyār Akaval and the Caravaṇapavaṉ Tōttiram are not found.
supportDesc.condition: Excellent state of preservation. Very few bore holes caused by insects.

additions.desc:
U1 (title-page)
f[1]r, lm, 1‒3 veṟṟivēl uṟṟa tuṇai
f[1]r, c1, 1–3 caivam mūṉṟu nāṅku
f[1]r, c2, 1 kantarantāti-y-urai
f[1]r, c2, 2 piḷḷaiyār akaval
f[1]r, c2, 3 caravaṇapavaṉ tōttiram
f[1]r, c3, 1–2 tiruppātiri-veṇpā-v-urai

binding.p: Woodcovers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Before 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1869).

acquisition.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855, later transfered to Bibliothèque Nationale (see Rosny 1869).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 8.
Vinson, Julien (1867‒1868). Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls. Corrected proofreadings printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. Access No. 4-IMPROR-77 (B). — See p. 11.

msPart.head: Kantarantāti-y-urai (text by Aruṇakirinātar and commentary interspersed)

summary.p: The Kantarantāti by Aruṇakirinātar (15th century) is a praise in verse of the god Murukaṉ. The text is incomplete. It stops at stanza n° 80.

msItem.title: Kantarantāti
msItem.author: Aruṇakirinātar
msItem.incipit: folio 2, recto = incipit: second Kāppu stanza = stanza n°1 (1 phrase quoted, followed after "=" sign by its paraphrase). Uṇ = kaṉṟukaḷaiyum = (…)
msItem.explicit:
folio 36, verso = excipit: stanza n° 80 (1 phrase quoted, followed after "=" sign by its paraphrase). Imaiyōr = tēvarkkaḻuṭaiya = makuṭam = kiṟīṭattiṟku kaṭṭā-niṉṟa = cikāvimpamē = parivaṭṭamē = cupparamaṇiyarukku āparaṇa-
m ākum = cikāvimpam eṉpatu = cikaiyiṟ kaṭṭukiṟa vasttirattiṟku peyar ākum = {pcs} 80

additions.desc:
U2a: folio 1, recto = invocation: marginal benediction (NB: vēyuṟutōḷipaṅkaṉ is the beginning of Tēvāram 2.85).
f1r, lm1, 1‒4 vēyuṟutōḷipaṅkaṉ ṟuṇai

U2a: folio 1, recto = title in left margin.
f1r, lm2, 1‒2 kantarantāti Urai

U2a: folio 1, recto and verso = Kāppu stanza, unnumbered (1 phrase quoted, followed after = sign by its paraphrase).
f1r1 vāraṇat tāṉai = nāṉku-maruppai-y-uṭaiya Ayirāvatattai-y-uṭaiya
f1r2 tēvēntiraṉaiyum = Ayaṉai = piramaṉaiyum = viṇṇōrai = tēvar-
f1r3 kkaḷaiyum = malarkkarattu = (...)
(...)
f1v2 (...) = vāḻttuvaṉ =
f1v3 tuti ceyvaṉ = Ē = īṟṟacai = Iḵtu vināyakaṉ aṟutiXX

summary.p: The Pātiri Veṇpā appears to be a poem praising the Lord Śiva of Tiruppātirippuliyūr, that is Pāṭaliputtiram, in the undivided South Arcot district of Tamil Nadu. The text is incomplete. It stops abruptly at stanza n° 79 at the end of the page (U3b, f37v).

msItem.title: Tiruppātiriveṇpā-v-urai
msItem.incipit:
folio 1, recto = incipit: Kāppu stanza (unnumbered) followed by further stanzas, numbered 1‒79. Stanzas are first quoted, the followed by patavurai and poḻippurai. cīr-pūtta-teyva-c-civa-k-koḻunt-ēṟippaṭ(ar)-p – pār-pūtta-pātiri-veṇpāvukku-t – tārpūtta – ceṉṉivaṉattā-
ṉai-mukaṉ ceṅ-kai-k ka(ṉ)ikavaruṅ – kaṉṉivaṉa-t-tāḷai mukaṉ kāppu eṉpatu patavurai cīr – celvam – pūtta
niṟainta – teyva – tivviyam ākiya – (...)
msItem.explicit:
folio 37, verso = excipit: stanza n° 79. (...)
(...) eṉṟa-v āṟu 78 yāka-p-pukai (...)
(...)
(...) kāppu Eṉpatu valatu pāricattilē yāka-p-pukai – veḷel eṉṟ’ e
ḻumpi maṟaittu maṟaiyātaX maṟṟai-y iṭatu pāricam – pacēl eṉṟ’ irukkiṟatu veṇmai-y-ākiya paramaciva-
ṉ iṭatu pāricattilē pacumai-y-ākiya pārvati-tēvi-y irukkiṟatu pōla viḷaṅkun tiruppātiri-y eṉṉun takuv(ā)-
ṉ atu – Uṭa-poruḷai-y uṇarv-alla – Irukkākiya vētamun tēṭi-k kāṉāmal Olamiṭṭ’ uraikkum pat(ara/ā)mpuyattai [the text stops here abruptly at the end of the page.]

support.p: U3a has width 285 mm, U3b has width 290 mm.

supportDesc.foliation: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page of Tiruppātiriveṇpā-v-urai, by hand n° 3.
37 folios, Tiruppātiriveṇpā-v-urai, by hand n° 3 or hand n°4.

handNote.desc: Title-page of Tiruppāṭiriveṅpā-v-urai, by hand n° 3. Possibly also same hand as U3b.
Tiruppāṭiriveṅpā-v-urai, by hand n° 3 or hand no° 4.

additions.desc:
U3a: folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page.
f[1]r1 tiruppātiri veṇpā
f[1]r2‒3 Oru-c-col-l-alaṅkāram.

U3b: folio 1, recto = incipit: marginal benedictions.
f1r, lm, 1 tirucciṟṟampalam
f1r, lm, 2 pātiri-veṇpā

U3b: folio 1, recto = incipit: title.
f1r, lm, 3‒4 Oru-coṟ-pala-poruḷ-alaṅkāra urai
f1r, lm, 5‒7 tiruppātirippuliyūr civakkoḻuntīcurar tuṇai

U3b: folio 37, verso = excipit: stanza n° 79. Marginal pratīka.
f37v, lm yāka-p-pukai

summary.p: The text is complete, that is, the 5 stanzas are complete.

supportDesc.foliation: 3 folio, unfoliated = Tiruvācakam stanzas, by hand n° 5.

listBibl.bibl: Pope, G. U. (1900). The Tiruvāçagam or ‘Sacred utterances’ of the Tamil Poet, Saint, and Sage Māṇikka-Vāçagar: The Tamil Text of the fifty-one Poems with English Translation, Introductions, and Notes. Oxford: The Clarendon Press.

encodingDesc.p: Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Transliteration conventions. Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbol between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right. Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets, e.g {mācam}. Line-filler: {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".

revisionDesc.change: This catalogue entry has been redacted by Emmanuel FRANCIS (CNRS, CEIAS UMR 8564, EHESS/CNRS) for the research program Texts Surrounding Texts (TST, FRAL 2018, ANR/DFG). Version 1, May 2020.
Converted from EAD to TEI by Charles LI.

p.note: folio 1, unfoliated, recto = Tiruvācakam stanzas: stanzas n° 4 and n° 6 of Tirukkōttumpi.

lg.l: kaṇṇappa ṉoppatō raṉpiṉmai kaṇṭapi ‡ ṉeṉṉappa ṉeṉ-
ṉai vāveṉṟa vāṉkaruṇai ‡ cuṇṇappoṉ ṉīṟṟaṟkē ceṉ-
ṟūtāy kōṟṟumpi [i.e. kōttumpī] ‡‡ vaittaniti peṇṭīr makkaḷ kulaṅ kalvi-
yeṉṉum ‡ pitta vulakiṟ piṟappō ṭiṟappeṉṉuñ ‡ citta vikārak
kalakkan teḷivitta ‡ vittakat tēvaṟkkē ceṉṟūtāy kōṟṟumpi [i.e. kōttumpī]

p.note: folio 2, unfoliated, recto = Tiruvācakam stanza: stanza n° 7 of Tirukkōttumpi.
folio 3, unfoliated, recto = Tiruvācakam stanzas: stanza n° 2 of Tiruppūvalli and stanza n° 2 of Tirukkōttumpi, in two columns.
